titleStmt.title: Two declarations the first from the Kings most Excellent majesty; to all his loyall subjects, wherein he declares his gracious will and pleasure concerning his two Houses of Parliament assembled at Westminster. Signed, Charles Rex. The second, concerning His Majesties coming to Oatlands, and the proceedings of His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, concerning his speedy comming to Londo n [sic]; as also the time.
titleStmt.author: Rishton, Robert.

titleStmt.title: Two declarations the first from the Kings most Excellent majesty; to all his loyall subjects, wherein he declares his gracious will and pleasure concerning his two Houses of Parliament assembled at Westminster. Signed, Charles Rex. The second, concerning His Majesties coming to Oatlands, and the proceedings of His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, concerning his speedy comming to Londo n [sic]; as also the time.
titleStmt.author: Rishton, Robert.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: A letter, dated and signed at end: Oatlands 15 of August, 1647. R. Rishton.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
